intro: Cocculus diantherus, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and Australia. It is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, warty fruits that contain a single, large, yellow seed. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in loose racemes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. The botanical features of Cocculus diantherus make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
